summary: Foreign nationals from 82 treaty countries may obtain E-2 nonimmigrant investor status in the United States. E-2 status allows eligible foreign nationals to temporarily stay here to run a business if they make a “substantial” investment in it and meet other qualifications. Their employees and family members may also obtain E-2 status. The State Department and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services told us determining E-2...
title: Nonimmigrant Investors: Actions Needed to Improve E-2 Visa Adjudication and Fraud Coordination
